facts.fact: Horses can sleep both lying down and standing up.
A horse’s teeth never stop growing throughout its life.
Horses have nearly 360-degree vision because of the placement of their eyes.
Foals can stand and walk within hours of being born.
The fastest recorded sprinting speed of a horse is 55 mph (88.5 km/h).
Horses communicate through facial expressions, ear movements, and vocal sounds.
A horse’s heart weighs around 9 to 10 pounds on average.
The Przewalski’s horse is the only true wild horse species still in existence.
